title: How to Make Chorizo, Potato and Kale Soup

steps.headline: Wash and peel potatoes.
steps.description: This is the most time consuming step.

steps.headline: Cut and rinse potatoes.
steps.description: The pieces should be bite sized, so take age into consideration if you are serving a family.

steps.headline: Start cooking potatoes.
steps.description: If you have never done it before, it is simple. Put the peeled, cut and rinsed potatoes in a soup pot. Cover with water until there is at least an inch of water above the potatoes. Place on the stove over medium high heat.

steps.headline: Brown the chorizo.
steps.description: In a skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until light brown and crumbly.

steps.headline: Add chorizo to potatoes.
steps.description: Scoop the meat from skillet, leaving grease in skillet, and mix it in with the potatoes. Potatoes should be almost finished.

steps.headline: Chop and wilt kale.
steps.description: Rinse and chop the Kale. In the skillet with the grease, sauté some chopped onion, and minced garlic until onion is transparent at the edges. Add the Kale for one minute. Drain grease, and add Kale mixture to the potatoes and chorizo.

steps.headline: Finish and serve.
steps.description: Mix well and continue cooking until potatoes are soft but not mushy. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

text: Wash and peel potatoes. This is the most time consuming step. Cut and rinse potatoes. The pieces should be bite sized, so take age into consideration if you are serving a family. Start cooking potatoes. If you have never done it before, it is simple. Put the peeled, cut and rinsed potatoes in a soup pot. Cover with water until there is at least an inch of water above the potatoes. Place on the stove over medium high heat. Brown the chorizo. In a skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until light brown and crumbly. Add chorizo to potatoes. Scoop the meat from skillet, leaving grease in skillet, and mix it in with the potatoes. Potatoes should be almost finished. Chop and wilt kale. Rinse and chop the Kale. In the skillet with the grease, sauté some chopped onion, and minced garlic until onion is transparent at the edges. Add the Kale for one minute. Drain grease, and add Kale mixture to the potatoes and chorizo. Finish and serve. Mix well and continue cooking until potatoes are soft but not mushy. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.
